overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Pragmatist
overall_perception_summary.description: Aquaphor is the ultimate utilitarian authority in the skincare aisle. It eschews all vanity and 'glow' to focus entirely on the medical restoration of broken skin barriers. It feels like a prescription you don't need a doctor to buy—sterile, reliable, and universally trusted to fix the unglamorous reality of chafing, cracking, and dryness.

foundation.title: The Medical Authority
foundation.description: The brand stands firmly as The Healer, deriving authority from the Clinical Lab and Dermatologist endorsement. Its value system is Safety First, prioritizing hypoallergenic tolerance over aggressive actives. The positioning is pure Medical Authority—a sterile, problem-solving utility that sits in the medicine cabinet, not the vanity.

identity.title: The Stoic Caregiver
identity.description: There is a professional distance here; the brand acts as a Reliable Expert rather than a friend. Dominated by The Caregiver (60%) and Sage (30%) archetypes, it uses Pharma-Code visuals (blue, white, grid) to signal safety. The tone is Clinical Authority—dry, precise, and devoid of humor or slang.

communication.title: Rational Problem Solver
communication.description: The messaging is purely functional, targeting The Problem (chafing, dryness) with Rational persuasion. The USP is The Specialist, owning the 'healing ointment' category with a specific semi-occlusive formula. The narrative is The Lab Breakthrough, relying on the 'Dermatologist Recommended' badge as the ultimate truth.

benefits.title: Restorative Relief
benefits.description: Functionally, it offers Restoration, physically shielding skin to allow for repair. The emotional payoff is Relief—the absence of pain or worry. Socially, it is The Safe Choice, allowing the user to blend into The Majority who prioritize efficacy over trends.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is entirely clinical—'#1 Dermatologist Recommended', 'Petrolatum', and 'Panthenol' signal that power comes from the lab, not the garden (Origin: 1/5 Pure Clinical). The goal is to fix a negative state, not enhance a positive one—'Relieves chapped, dry or cracked skin', 'Soothes chafing', and 'Healing' are about curing pathology, not adding glow (Mission: 1/5 Pathology Cure). Lab authority + pathology focus = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Relieves chapped, dry or cracked skin... Soothes chafing... Petrolatum (skin protectant)... Panthenol

marker_2.reasoning: The mission is laser-focused on micro-correction—fixing specific spots of 'dry, irritated skin' or 'chapped lips' rather than changing the world or the industry (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). The product is universally accessible, found in every drugstore and priced for the mass market (Access: 5/5 Democratic). Highly specific fixing power + mass access = The Democratizers of skin repair.
marker_2.evidence: On-the-go solution... Relieves chapped lips... dry skin patches... friction burns... Available at major retailers

marker_3.reasoning: The brand prioritizes safety above all else. Claims like 'Fragrance free', 'Preservative free', 'Suitable for sensitive skin', and 'Hypoallergenic' signal that avoiding reaction is more important than aggressive results (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is delivered through clinical evidence and clear drug fact labels rather than storytelling (Transparency: 2/5 Evidence-First).
marker_3.evidence: Fragrance free... Preservative free... Hypoallergenic... Suitable for sensitive skin... Drug Facts Label

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is purely functional—clinical blue and white packaging, medical sans-serif fonts, and zero decorative elements. It looks like it belongs in a first-aid kit (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The value proposition is a reliable essential—something you buy to have on hand for emergencies, not for luxury (Value: 2/5 Daily Essential).
marker_4.evidence: Clinical blue packaging... Drug Facts panel... Multi-purpose... Essential solution

marker_5.reasoning: The personality is cool and professional. There are no exclamation points, no slang, and no 'we love this' energy. It is polite but removed (Thermostat: 2/5 Distant). It speaks with the authority of a specialist—'Clinically proven', 'Skin protectant'—positioning itself as the expert in the room (Power Dynamic: 4/5 Specialist).
marker_5.evidence: Clinically proven... Skin protectant... Dermatologist recommended... Multi-purpose solution

marker_6.reasoning: The primary drive is to protect and heal—'Healing Balm', 'Protectant', 'Relief'—which is the essence of The Caregiver (60%). This is backed by The Sage (30%), represented by the 'Dermatologist Recommended' and clinical validation. A small dose of The Everyman (10%) appears in its universal, family-friendly accessibility. Caregiver + Sage = The Stabilizers, offering order (health) in the chaos of injury.
marker_6.evidence: Healing Balm... Skin Protectant... #1 Dermatologist Recommended... For the whole family

marker_7.reasoning: The voice is devoid of humor or entertainment (Humor: 1/5 Grave). It uses standard, professional English with medical terminology like 'semi-occlusive' and 'active ingredient' (Formality: 2/5 Traditional). It respects the user's condition without coddling (Respect: 2/5 Respectful) and delivers facts with zero emotional hyping (Enthusiasm: 1/5 Clinical).
marker_7.evidence: Active ingredient: Petrolatum (30%)... Purpose: Skin Protectant... Apply as needed... mess-free application

marker_8.reasoning: The visual world is defined by medical dark blue, clinical white, and accent teal. It is cold and hygienic (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is rigid, using standard pharmaceutical information hierarchy and clean product shots on white backgrounds (Entropy: 1/5 Swiss Grid).
marker_8.evidence: Dark blue header... White background... Teal accent color... Droplet icon... Clean stick packaging
marker_8.look_and_feel: A sterile, trustworthy medical aesthetic that signals safety and efficacy.
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical dark blue and white with accents of medical teal and alert red.

marker_9.reasoning: The messaging leads with the result: 'Relieves', 'Soothes', 'Protects'. It targets the outcome of the application (Hook: 4/5 Result). The persuasion is rooted in rational, clinical logic—citing 'Petrolatum (30%)', 'Clinically proven', and 'Dermatologist Recommended' rather than emotional stories (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data). Result-led + Data-backed = The Problem Solver.
marker_9.evidence: Relieves dry skin... Soothes chafing... Clinically proven... Petrolatum (30%)... #1 Dermatologist Recommended

marker_10.reasoning: The story isn't about a founder; it's about 'Dermatologists' and 'Clinical heritage'. The hero is the medical consensus (Protagonist: 1/5 Nobel). The setting is implied to be the sterile manufacturing lab or the doctor's office, devoid of nature or kitchens (Setting: 1/5 Sterile).
marker_10.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Clinical heritage... 90 years of expertise... Formulated for...

marker_11.reasoning: The ultimate validator is the 'Dermatologist'. The '#1 Recommended' claim is the primary trust anchor (Validator: 1/5 The Board). The proof is clinical—'Clinically proven to relieve' is a statement of scientific fact, not a lifestyle observation (Proof: 1/5 The Graph).
marker_11.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand... Clinically proven... Skin Protectant... Drug Facts

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: Aquaphor owns the 'Advanced Therapy' and semi-occlusive formula mental model. They aren't just Petrolatum; they are *Aquaphor* (Ownership: 3/5 Complex). The scope is problem-focused: dry, cracked, irritated skin. You don't use this for 'beauty'; you use it for 'repair' (Scope: 4/5 Problem).
marker_12.evidence: Aquaphor Healing Ointment formula... Advanced Therapy... For dry, cracked skin... Chapped lips... Chafing

marker_13.reasoning: The content explains *how* it works ('semi-occlusive', 'allows skin to breathe'). It educates the user on the mechanism of healing (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to prove efficacy and safety to build trust, rather than to create desire or close a quick sale (Intent: 1/5 Thesis).
marker_13.evidence: Semi-occlusive... Creates a protective barrier... Allows oxygen to flow... How it works

marker_14.reasoning: This is a Fixer. It targets 'cracked', 'chapped', and 'irritated' skin to reverse damage (Action: 5/5 Fixer). The outcome is biological health—restoring the skin barrier—not aesthetic perfection. It doesn't promise you'll look pretty; it promises you'll be healed (Outcome: 1/5 Biological).
marker_14.evidence: Relieves cracked skin... Heals dry lips... Skin protectant... Restores smooth skin... Soothes friction burns

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: The emotional driver is the removal of pain or discomfort. It addresses the 'Panic Mode' of having cracked, bleeding, or chafed skin (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is internal safety—feeling comfortable in your own skin again, without concern for external status (Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary).
marker_15.evidence: Relief... Soothes... Protects... Sensitive skin... Mess-free application

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: Buying Aquaphor is purely pragmatic. It is a Tool for a job (Signal: 1/5 Tool). It is The Standard—the default choice for tattoos, babies, and dry lips. There is no attempt to be cool or exclusive; it's the rational default (Tribal: 1/5 Standard).
marker_16.evidence: Multi-purpose... For the whole family... #1 Brand... Essential... On-the-go

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization (I want to look like everyone else)
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is Normalization—getting your skin back to normal so you don't stand out for the wrong reasons (Social: 1/5 Normalization). The group dynamic is The Majority; using Aquaphor aligns you with the massive crowd of people who trust this heritage brand (Group: 1/5 Majority).
marker_17.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Trusted by millions... For dry skin needs
